responses: To start MATLAB, double-click the MATLAB shortcut icon on your Windows desktop. You will know MALTAB is running when you see the special prompt in the MATLAB Command Window.
To end your MATLAB session, select Exit MATLAB from the File menu in the desktop, or type quit (or exit) in the Command Window, or with easy way by click on close button in control box.

patterns: For what Command window is used?
responses: Command Window is used to enter variables and run functions and M-files.
MATLAB file operations use the current directory reference point. Any file you want to run must be in the current directory or on the search path.
The MATLAB workspace consists of the set of variables (named arrays) built up during a MATLAB session and stored in memory.
Removes all variables from workspace
Clears the Command window and homes the cursor.
help <Topic> displays help about that Topic if it exist.

intents.tag: Checking Number of Virtual Machines at a Time
patterns: How to check Number of Virtual Machines at a Time?
How to check Number of VM's at a Time?
responses: The Number of virtual machines capacity will be differs by the Following Criteria: 1. Capacity of the host operating system 2. Memory, CPU and storage capacity of the virtual machines

patterns: How to Install C compiler and run a C program in virtual machine?
Tell me the steps for Install C compiler and run a C program in virtual machine?
responses: Load a virtual machine in opennebula,Open sunstone by usin URL http://localhost:9869/ ,Dash board -> Instance-> VMs ,Run the Following command in the virtual machine terminal, psudo apt-get update ,psudo apt-get install gcc g++ ,Type the C program using gedit,Compile and Run the C Program

patterns: How to doDevelop applications using Java or C/C++ Grid APIs
Tell me the steps for Developing applications using Java or C/C++ Grid APIs?
responses: 1. Import all the necessary java packages and name the file as GridLayoutDemo.java, 2. Set up components to preferred size , 3. Add buttons to experiment with Grid Layout , 4. Add controls to set up horizontal and vertical gaps , 5. Process the Apply gaps button press , 6. Create the GUI , 7. Create and set up the window, Set up the content pane and Display the window , 8. Schedule a job for the event dispatch thread , 9. Show the application's GUI

responses: Create new project,Select ASP.NET Empty Web Application,Give a name to your project and click ok button,Go to Solution Explorer and right click at your project,Select Add New Item and select Web Service application,Give it name and click ok button

patterns: How to do stack uploading using grid services ,Tell me the steps for stack uploading using grid services
responses: Building the Service ,Type -->ant generate.service,deploy the --> Axis2_HOME/samples/quickstart/build/StockQuoteService.aar,Create --> ant generate.wsdl from quickstart directory,- From your browser, If you point to the following URL: http://localhost:8080/axis2/services/StockQuoteService/getPrice?symbol=IBM ,You will get the following response: <ns:getPriceResponse><ns:return>42.0</ns:return></ns:getPriceResponse>  .If you invoke the update method like so: http://localhost:8080/axis2/services/StockQuoteService/update?symbol=IBM&price=100  And then execute the first getPriceurl. You can see that the price got updated.
